channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Charter Schools Are Not ‘State Actors,’ And SCOTUS Should Have Said So
item.description: Charter schools need more autonomy than district schools if American families are going to have real choice in education.

item.title: James Comey, Who Should Be In Prison, Shills On Cover-Up Queen Psaki’s Show
item.description: In a grotesquely pandering interview more flaccid than Comey’s conscience, Psaki let the weaselly old Deep Stater do what he does best: lie.

item.title: Support School Choice To Save America’s Lost Boys
item.description: An Urban Institute study reports significant benefits for male students who participated in EdChoice, Ohio’s school choice voucher program.

item.title: Trump’s Ominous Threat to Apple
item.description: The president of the United States is not a king whose words carry the power of law, yet businessmen have found it smart to act as though they do.

item.title: Rubio announces visa restrictions for foreigners 'complicit' in censoring Americans
item.description: The Trump State Department took aim at foreign authorities "complicit" in censoring Americans' free speech by imposing new visa restrictions.

item.title: Texas border sheriff says illegal crossings have seen ‘dramatic decline’ as CA migrant center shuts down
item.description: A Texas border sheriff explained the dramatic decline in illegal crossings he is seeing at the border just days after a California migrant facility cl...

item.title: Springsteen’s Quisling Concert
item.description: Borrowed politics defeat a former rock-music hero.

item.title: Trump says Canada might join states in exchange for free missile defense protection
item.description: President Trump said Canada is "considering" becoming the 51st state in exchange for free protection by the proposed "Golden Dome" defense system.

item.title: The Fortune 500 in 1972: 116 consumer products in one beautiful collage
item.description: Everything, everywhere, all at once.

item.title: The Left Will Never Recover from Donald Trump
item.description: Trump has shifted the Overton window in the culture away from woke, and it’s hard to imagine it shifting all the way back.

item.title: Macy’s latest earnings show the CEO’s turnaround plan is working despite a looming tariff threat
item.description: Wall Street thinks it could have been much worse for the beleaguered department store chain.

item.title: Watchdog finds 'no evidence' Biden knew of crucial climate EOs, demands answers on who signed autopen
item.description: A pro-energy group is sounding the alarm and calling for an investigation into who signed key Biden executive orders, given rising concerns about his ...

item.title: Exclusive: Stablecoin company Conduit raises $36 million from Dragonfly Capital and Altos Ventures
item.description: The company will use the money raised to expand into Asia and diversify its client base.

item.title: Douglas Murray Is Too Worried About Decorum To Say What Needs To Be Said
item.description: Whenever I read Douglas Murray, I suddenly find myself longing for the ear-splitting sound of heavy-duty steel pounding rapidly into concrete.

item.title: The Clock Is Running Out for Covid Fraud Investigations
item.description: A bill to allow more time to track down and file charges for these massive fraud schemes is languishing in the Senate.

item.title: Media Falls Over Itself To Defend South African President Who Claimed Genocidal Chants Were Free Speech
item.description: Despite the media's best attempt to cover, South Africa's president excused the genocidal chants as free speech.

item.title: Trump vows pardon for reality-star family the Chrisleys
item.description: The White House announced that reality TV stars Julie and Todd Chrisley will be receiving pardons from President Trump.

item.title: How to watch the Scripps National Spelling Bee—and how much money is on the line
item.description: 99 young quarterfinalists are left to duke it out.

item.title: Nonprofits are finally figuring out how to get disillusioned Gen Zers to fix their own communities: You just have to give them money
item.description: It's the latest example of how organizations are trying to empower and encourage Gen Z to get involved in philanthropy.

item.title: DeSantis goads Congress to follow FL’s DOGE blueprint as Musk’s cuts still wait for vote
item.description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis calls for federal spending cuts, praising DOGE's success and Elon Musk's efforts, as Congress faces pressure to act on GOP c...

item.title: DOJ sues North Carolina over voter rolls
item.description: The DOJ accuses North Carolina of violating the Help America Vote Act by not maintaining accurate voter registration records, impacting election integ...

item.title: Tariffs, Inflation, and Returns: How Investments Respond to Supply Shocks
item.description: Learn how tariff-related inflation shocks ripple through markets—and which assets have historically helped investors navigate the turbulence.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump's attempt to shut down New York's congestion pricing
item.description: A federal judge issued a restraining order Tuesday blocking the Trump administration from punishing New York for its congestion pricing plan that char...

item.title: Judge permanently halts Trump's order punishing WilmerHale
item.description: A federal judge on Tuesday struck down President Trump's order targeting the law firm of WilmerHale, warning - with Trumpian exclamation marks through...

item.title: Justice Dept. sues to clean North Carolina's voting rolls
item.description: The Trump Justice Department announced a lawsuit Tuesday against North Carolina, challenging the state to clean up its voter rolls and remove names of...

item.title: Big and Beautiful: The House Defunds Planned Parenthood
item.description: A major milestone for pro-lifers looms if the Senate passes the House version of the One Big Beautiful Bill.

item.title: Women in Alts: Leading with Inspiration, Intuition, and Impact
item.description: Women investors are redefining alternatives with bold leadership, values-driven decisions, and long-term impact.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.

item.title: Tariffs and Returns: Lessons from 150 Years of Market History
item.description: What 150 years of market data reveal about tariffs, growth, and investment returns—and how equity factors have historically delivered resilience.

item.title: Vices, Virtues, and a Little Humor: 30 Quotes from Financial History
item.description: This collection of quotes from US financial history offers timeless lessons in vice, virtue, and investing wisdom for every generation.
